a0.speaker: Marisa:
a0.dialogue: I can't believe that the culprit's hideout has those symbols that I saw earlier.

a1.speaker: Marisa:
a1.dialogue: Or when tools begin to rebel, what if...

a2.speaker: Raiko:
a2.dialogue: Who's there? Is that Jane? Oh, it's not her but that girl in a witch outfit. What do you want here?

a3.speaker: Marisa:
a3.dialogue: Oh, you are the same person I met during that magical storm a while ago, but you look a bit different from last time...

a4.speaker: Marisa:
a4.dialogue: Tell me, why are you even here? You're supposed to be with the Prismrivers, y'know.

a5.speaker: Raiko:
a5.dialogue: Prismrivers? I haven't heard of them or been a part of them. And the reason I am here in the first place?

a6.speaker: Raiko:
a6.dialogue: I feel that Gensokyo is a gloomy place plagued by turmoils.

a7.speaker: Raiko:
a7.dialogue: Many of the so-called incidents happen within a small timeframe. Poor them; they must be living in constant fear.

a8.speaker: Raiko:
a8.dialogue: And that's why my Grand Concert exists in the first place - to bring back joy to a land ravaged by sadness and fear!

a9.speaker: Marisa:
a9.dialogue: Absolute nonsense. I and many other Gensokyo denizens have been involved in those incidents many times.

a10.speaker: Marisa:
a10.dialogue: They were indifferent towards the situation. Anyway, I must say that your musical choices are absolute trash.

a11.speaker: Marisa:
a11.dialogue: Lyrics such as 'Hallelujah' and 'Praise the Lord' are simply lame words that are directed as heretical deities.

a12.speaker: Marisa:
a12.dialogue: You better find somewhere else to host your concert. Gensokyo is not the place to do this.

a13.speaker: Raiko:
a13.dialogue: This young lady is underestimating the powers of these heavenly words.

a14.speaker: Raiko:
a14.dialogue: It won't hurt to praise the holy name of the Lord, and in return, you will receive eternal life in the Lord.

a15.speaker: Raiko:
a15.dialogue: But for this lady, she is a mere infidel, denying the benefits of praising the Lord.

a16.speaker: Marisa:
a16.dialogue: Uh... something's wrong. I can feel it. Are you okay, Raiko?

a17.speaker: Raiko:
a17.dialogue: Good question. Everything is going to be okay unless you keep that attitude towards the Lord.

a18.speaker: Raiko:
a18.dialogue: If you are still an impenitent and irreverent young lady...

a19.speaker: Raiko:
a19.dialogue: The gates of the cursed cities of Sodom and Gomorrah shall be open for you!

a20.speaker: Raiko:
a20.dialogue: Prepare to feel the fire and brimstone as I am burning you on the pyre!
